Homogeneize for most differences

Homogeneize for most differences

homogeneize(..., sample = 60, procrustes = TRUE, center = TRUE,
  template = TRUE)

Arguments

...

list of shapes or comma-separated shapes
sample

if numeric (default=60 defau), resample this number of points with Momocs::coo_sample
procrustes

logical (default=TRUE) whether to remove position, size, rotation differences with Momocs::fgProcrustes
center

logical (default=TRUE) whether to center shapes with Momocs::coo_center
template

logical (default=TRUE) whether to template shapes with Momocs::coo_template

Examples

# two shapes, comma separated
homogeneize(shapes[1], shapes[2])
#> iteration: 1	gain:178.9
#> iteration: 2	gain:0.0025843
#> iteration: 3	gain:0.00061828

# list of shapes, in a pipe, and drawing
shapes[1:2] %>% homogeneize %>%
 paper %>% draw_outlines
#> iteration: 1	gain:178.9
#> iteration: 2	gain:0.0025843
#> iteration: 3	gain:0.00061828
#> iteration: 4	gain:5.6742e-05
#> iteration: 5	gain:0.00048404
#> iteration: 6	gain:0.00019146
#> iteration: 7	gain:3.7569e-05
#> iteration: 8	gain:7.5552e-06

# with params
shapes[1:10] %>% homogeneize(sample=12, procrustes=FALSE) %>%
 paper %>% draw_outlines(col=pal_seq_Blues(10, 0.5))
